Hi #Rstats twitter. Know the struggle with copy-pasting win explorer paths to your R session and converting \ to \\ or / ?
Since R 4.0.0 you can actually just path <- r"(test\test)" to evade this problem 😁.
This is old news but I got a feeling that now everybody knows. https://t.co/KRfvG96Dtq

🎉 The dev version of the {equatiomatic} #rstats 📦now handles mixed effects/multilevel models via `lme4::lmer`! Still fairly experimental so would love for you to try it out! See the new vignette covering quite a few different model specifications here: https://t.co/royMN8lM3O https://t.co/pDAl6dbWIu
